Posts.Content: Way to go -- it is a good feeling -- I am really happy for you. Debbie

Posts.Title: I'm Finished! I'm Finished!

Posts.Content: Hi, Has anyone heard from their oncologists regarding the recently completed studies regarding herceptin? Mine just called me and I have an appointment to see her on June 6th. I am in remission -- so I will have to decide if I want to try this as a protective measure................ I don't have details as of yet. i think she would have like to have us there now (she is 3 hours away) We own our own business (I run it) My hubby works for the city -- it is Memorial Day weekend/graduation/plus we are getting ready for a sale.... I think since I am in remission that it is OK to wait until the 6th. Just curious to see if anyone else is looking at herceptin. thanks Debbie
Posts.Signature: 45 dx 09/03 nodes 3+ of 22 stage IIB er-/her2+ bilateral mastectomy chemo/more chemo w/Taxotere 38 rad Currently undergoing Herceptin treatmens
Posts.Title: Herceptin for earlier stages of her2 patients

Posts.Content: Hi, I am new to this site -- I was diagnosed in Sept 2003 -- had a bilateral mastectomy - I did A/C 2 weeks on 2 weeks off for 6 months then taxotere 3 weeks on 1 week off for 4 months followed by 35 radiation treatments -- I was done with everything in Sept 2004 -- I am having a lot of pain and stiffness -- some is arthiritis -- also wondering about lipitor - I was put on it in January -- low dose 5mg -- I have good cholesterol (153) but the CRP (risk for heart attack in the future) jumped to 18 after all of my treatments ended ..... now it is at a 7 ....... so I am trying to get the docs to agree to me stopping the lipitor to see if the joint/bone pain is it -- I feel better after reading some of the other posts about the length of time the taxotere related pain can last -- it was better when I was swimming 4-5 times a week (pool is closed for 6 weeks -- college facility) my skin was reacting terribly so it needed a break -- but my muscles and bones need the low impact -- I am frustrated -- (oh I am 45--I forgot that on my signature) Thanks

AgeInfo.Phrase: am frustrated     oh I am 45  I forgot that on my

Posts.Signature: 45 dx 09/03 nodes 3+ of 22 stage IIB er-/her2+ bilateral mastectomy chemo/more chemo w/Taxotere 38 rad Currently undergoing Herceptin treatmens
Posts.Title: Taxotere Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hi, I am 3 years out -- I had a bilateral mastectomy -- chemo including taxotere and radiation. I was done with all of that when the herceptin study was completed. I qualified for a year of herceptin and finished that in May -- technically it isn't chemo but my insurance company called it chemo and I figure they are paying for it so they can call it whatever they want. I didn't really have any side effects (other than sever leg cramps - cramps in the upper thighs -- my onc wasn't really sure that they were only being caused from the herceptin -- but about 6 weeks after I was all done getting herceptin I had no more leg cramps. It is a long time to be continuing treatment -- but as a her2+ patient I felt that it was worth it. Good Luck
Posts.Signature: 45 dx 09/03 nodes 3+ of 22 stage IIB er-/her2+ bilateral mastectomy chemo/more chemo w/Taxotere 38 rad Currently undergoing Herceptin treatmens

Posts.Title: Sex is not possible anymore

Posts.Content: Hi, I have had 4 herceptin treatments (I am getting them every 3 weeks) and I recently noticed that I seem to be bruising easily. Has anyone else had this experience? thanks Debbie
Posts.Signature: 45 dx 09/03 nodes 3+ of 22 stage IIB er-/her2+ bilateral mastectomy chemo/more chemo w/Taxotere 38 rad Currently undergoing Herceptin treatmens
Posts.Title: herceptin and bruising

Posts.Content: Thanks -- I had done a lot of research prior to starting herceptin and I had found no mention of bruising. A friend of mine is also doing herceptin (her treatments are weekly where as mine are every 3 weeks) and she is bruising as well. They are monitoring my blood counts closely and so far everything is staying within normal range. I will mention this to my onc and take it from there. Thanks for your response. Debbie
